snippet: Officials said 63,000 applicants had already been scheduled for fingerprints and photographs, the second step in the process.
abstract: Homeland Security Dept officials announce that more than 82,000 illegal immigrants have applied for a two-year reprieve from deportation in the first 30 working days of an Obama administration program, and 29 have been approved.
lead_paragraph: Officials said 63,000 applicants had already been scheduled for fingerprints and photographs, the second step in the process.

headline.main: U.S. Says Fast Pace Continues on Reprieves for Young Immigrants
